decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence while utilizing cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Goblin Bombardment to deal damage quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury while maintaining control with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm. Additionally, cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and buffs for the deck's creatures. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around pushing for quick victories through aggressive plays and efficient card synergies.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creature plays like Seasoned Pyromancer, Ragavan, and Guide of Souls. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional value by creating tokens and enhancing the team's stats. The deck's mana base is optimized with a mix of lands to ensure consistent plays and pressure on the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games swiftly with its aggressive creatures and removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt and control your opponent's game plan while also dealing consistent damage through strong creatures. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Relic of Progenitus, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slow them down. At the same time, creatures like Ketramose and Phelia provide a strong offensive presence, pushing the opponent towards defeat. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp for added value and flexibility in gameplay.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It uses a combination of low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, along with direct damage spells such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with relentless attacks and burn spells, while also utilizing cards like Searing Blaze and Skullcrack to disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to close out the game as soon as possible before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up artifacts and utilizing them for aggression, through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, removal, and counterspells while generating additional value from cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Razortide Bridge provides additional synergies and versatility to the deck, allowing for different lines of play and adapting to various matchups. The deck's efficiency and flexibility make it a formidable opponent in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on creating explosive early game plays and overwhelming opponents with a mix of creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly build a strong board presence, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide additional damage and removal options. The inclusion of cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Thraben Charm help maintain momentum and disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out games before opponents can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure through evasive creatures and removal spells. By combining disruptive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Additionally, utilizing flicker effects with cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp allows for additional disruption and value generation. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a proactive game plan while disrupting the opponent's resources and strategies.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana ramp with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore, eventually leading to casting Primeval Titan to tutor for lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva. By using cards like Scapeshift, the deck is able to quickly assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and direct damage from Valakut triggers. The deck also includes utility lands like Tolaria West and Boseiju, Who Endures to ensure the combo pieces can be fetched efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to use various cards to mill the opponent's library as quickly as possible in order to win the game through decking them out. Cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Archive Trap, Glimpse the Unthinkable, and Fractured Sanity are used to mill cards from the opponent's library, while Tasha's Hideous Laughter can exile cards from their library. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements such as Drown in the Loch and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board and ensure a successful mill strategy.

The deck focuses on using a toolbox of creatures to combo off and generate value in the mid-to-late game. Agatha's Soul Cauldron helps to recur important pieces from the graveyard, while cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provide card draw and removal. Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling help to tutor for specific creatures in different situations. The deck also features versatile creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Endurance to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the strategy revolves around finding the right creatures at the right time to outvalue and outpace the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans and controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Thought Scour and Consider for card selection and Unearth for graveyard recursion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while protecting its own threats like Murktide Regent. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, the deck seeks to dominate the game through careful control and resource management.

The deck is focused on utilizing Underworld Breach along with Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to create a powerful combo. The goal is to fill up the graveyard quickly with Mishra's Bauble and other cheap artifacts to enable continuous recursion and milling of the opponent's deck until Thassa's Oracle can be played to win the game outright. The deck includes various cards to help with card selection and protection, as well as additional win conditions like Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat. The synergy between all the cards allows for a fast and consistent combo finish.
